Title: TEXEM Learning DNA: Distinctive, interactive, outcome–driven
Summary: Conventional executive education often leans on prestige, ivy‑clad campuses, grand auditoriums and case studies frozen in time . TEXEM’s Learning DNA rejects that nostalgia . It is built on three non‑negotiables: distinction, interaction and outcome .

Title: Governor Ahmad Aliyu Sokoto and the Mabera community
Summary: For Governor Ahmad Aliyu Sokoto, the main purpose of development is to help increase the choices and opportunities for the people of Sokoto State . Since his assumption of office on May 29, 2023, the governor has taken several initiatives .

Title: Jim Iyke’s sin in Port Harcourt, Lagos
Summary: Jim Iyke's latest film, Sin, was screened at Box Office Cinemas, Rumuomasi, Port Harcourt, Rivers State and Terra Kulture, Victoria Island, Lagos recently .

Title: Tinubu meets GenCos, moves  to resolve N4tn debt overhang
Summary: Tinubu assured electricity generation companies (GENCOs) of his administration’s readiness to resolve the sector's decade-long liquidity crisis . Federal Government begins verification and validation of debt overhang .

Title: Face of independence 2025 journey begins
Summary: Face of Independence Beauty Pageant and Hero’s Award have announced the 2025 edition . Focused on human capacity development, the organisers of the pageant announced the event in Lagos .

Title: FG reaffirms commitment to education reform
Summary: Vice-President Kashim Shettima has reaffirmed the Federal Government’s commitment to transforming Nigeria’�s education sector through strategic support and reforms . The Vice President said the government is committed to transforming the education sector .

Title: When pushed to a wall…
Summary: For 2015 and 2019, it was Muhammadu Buhari, says Martin Ugboma . As an idealist young man, I detested the lack of a lack of leadership in Nigeria .

Title: Police bust kidnap gang in Kaduna, arrest six, recover four rifles
Summary: Kaduna State Police Command has busted a notorious kidnapping syndicate operating in Jema’a Local Government Area . The breakthrough followed a distress report filed by a resident of Ungwan Ninzom, Jagindi Tasha village, whose son, Hussaini Ibrahim, was kidnapped .

Title: Stop discussing politics, focus on governance, Obi tells politicians
Summary: Labour Party presidential candidate during the 2023 General election, Mr Peter Obi has called on politicians to stop discussing politics and focus on the development of the people . Obi: 'My focus is on pulling Nigerians out of poverty, not 2027•Donates N20m to UNiCAL dentistry for 5 surgical chairs'

Title: Two Nigerians arrested in India over drugs, face deportation
Summary: The Nigerians, Aful Clement, 29, and Lazarus Favour, 19, were nabbed by the Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing on Wednesday . Clement entered India on a business visa and was previously arrested in a 2022 cheating case by Chandigarh police, and was jailed for six months . He stayed in Delhi without any

Title: Group unveils report on disability inclusion
Summary: The report is the first comprehensive national assessment providing data-driven insights on disability inclusion across key sectors, including education, health, employment, policy, and social protection . It highlights critical gaps and opportunities to strengthen inclusive governance and practices across the country .

Title: ASUU to sue FG over UNIMAID renaming after Buhari
Summary: The Academic Staff Union of Universities, University of Maiduguri chapter, has “vehemently rejected and strongly condemned” the Federal Government’s decision to rename the institution after the late former President Muhammadu Buhari . The union said the decision was “ill-conceived, arbitrary, and devoid of meaningful

Title: SDP crisis deepens as NEC sacks NWC members, party disowns El-Rufai
Summary: The Social Democratic Party dissolved the National Working Committee led by suspended National Chairman, Shehu Gabam . The newly constituted interim leadership includes Adamu Modibo (National Chairman), Abubakar Dogara (Deputy Chairman), Ekpeyong Ambo (National Secretary), Joseph Abu (National Organising Secretary), and Chief Solsu
